00016 
00017 package WeBWorK::DB::Utils::SQLAbstractIdentTrans;
00018 use base qw(SQL::Abstract);
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::DB::Utils::SQLAbstractIdentTrans - subclass of SQL::Abstract that
00023 allows custom hooks to transform identifiers.
00024 
00025 =cut
00026 
00027 use strict;
00028 use warnings;
00029 
00030 sub _table  {
00031     my $self = shift;
00032     my $tab  = shift;
00033     if (ref $tab eq 'ARRAY') {
00034         return join ', ', map { $self->_quote_table($_) } @$tab;
00035     } else {
00036         return $self->_quote_table($tab);
00037     }
00038 }
00039 
00040 sub _quote {
00041     my $self  = shift;
00042     my $label = shift;
00043     
00044     return $label if $label eq '*';
00045     
00046     return $self->_quote_field($label)
00047         if !defined $self->{name_sep};
00048     
00049     if (defined $self->{transform_all}) {
00050         return $self->{transform_all}->($label);
00051     } elsif ($label =~ /(.+)\.(.+)/) {
00052         return $self->_quote_table($1) . $self->{name_sep} . $self->_quote_field($2);
00053     } else {
00054         return $self->_quote_field($label);
00055     }
00056 }
00057 
00058 sub _quote_table {
00059     my $self  = shift;
00060     my $label = shift;
00061     
00062     # if the table name is a scalar reference, leave it alone (but dereference it)
00063     return $$label if ref $label eq "SCALAR";
00064     
00065     # call custom transform function
00066     $label = $self->{transform_table}->($label)
00067         if defined $self->{transform_table};
00068     
00069     return $self->{quote_char} . $label . $self->{quote_char};
00070 }
00071 
00072 sub _quote_field {
00073     my $self  = shift;
00074     my $label = shift;
00075     
00076     # call custom transform function
00077     $label = $self->{transform_field}->($label)
00078         if defined $self->{transform_field};
00079     
00080     return $self->{quote_char} . $label . $self->{quote_char};
00081 }
00082 
00083 sub _order_by {
00084     my $self = shift;
00085     my $ref = ref $_[0];
00086 
00087     my @vals = $ref eq 'ARRAY'  ? @{$_[0]} :
00088                $ref eq 'SCALAR' ? $_[0]    : # modification: don't dereference scalar refs
00089                $ref eq ''       ? $_[0]    :
00090                SQL::Abstract::puke "Unsupported data struct $ref for ORDER BY";
00091 
00092     # modification: if an item is a scalar ref, don't quote it, only dereference it
00093     my $val = join ', ', map { ref $_ eq "SCALAR" ? $$_ : $self->_quote($_) } @vals;
00094     return $val ? $self->_sqlcase(' order by')." $val" : '';
00095 }
00096 
00097 1;
